title: Lead Data Analyst - Product Supply
description:
EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

The remote option applies only to the Candidates who will be working from any location in Poland.

DESCRIPTION
You can join one of our offices, which are located in Warsaw, Krakow, Wroclaw, Katowice and Gdansk or work fully remotely. We are supporting Employment Contract or B2B, depending on your preferences.

ABOUT THE PROJECT
The Global Product Supply Analytics team focuses on bringing digital... transformation and innovation by creating best in class analytical solutions enabling data-driven decision making and performance optimization.

You will be part of the Global Data Assets & Analytics organization with full accountability for ideation, design, delivery, and adoption Product Supply analytics products. You will partner with business sponsors, data science, and technical engineering teams to identify solutions where analytics can be used to differentiate our offering and add value to our customers.
Responsibilities
• Define, develop, and execute analytical products strategy, features and criteria for evaluating vendors/partners to make ongoing buy/build or partner decisions
• Design the Product Supply analytics products vision while gathering and prioritizing requirements and partner with cross functional stakeholders all the way up to senior leadership to drive flawless implementation of your vision
• Lead and manage an external team that designs and implements new analytical products in an agile fashion
• Orchestrate analytics product launches and releases including training for internal users
• Align with data assets and analytics strategy by producing and contributing to building internal data assets
• Ensure all products have considered business value/outcomes, usability, viability, and feasibility
• Drive change and influence the organization beyond the IT function by cultivating cross-functional collaboration, and realizing business outcomes leveraging the power of data & analytics
• Ensure analytical products generate insights to accelerate data driven culture and decision making
Requirements
• Strong analytics experience, ideally in an agile environment supporting the life cycle of supply analytical products (development, testing, launch, training support)
• Supply chain management and product lifecycle experience
• Good knowledge of Data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI)
• Familiar with data-related toolset: Azure Cloud, Snowflake, Databricks
• High analytical drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a fast-paced environment
• Strong communication and collaboration skills
• Excellent problem-solving and analysis skills, combined with impeccable business judgement
• Ability to evolve product strategy based on research, data and industry trends
• Ability to communicate and influence effectively by presenting data in a compelling way
• Fluent in English, both written and spoken
• Master's degree in computer science, business, management or similar
We offer
• Team & working conditions:
• Friendly team and enjoyable working environment
• Engineering community of industry's professionals
• Flexible schedule and opportunity to work remotely
• Relocation within our offices
• Corporate and social events
• Benefits package (health insurance, multisport, shopping vouchers)
• Stable income:
• Employment Contract or B2B
• Regular assessments and salary reviews
• Participation in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan
• Referral bonuses
• Career development:
• Innovative solutions delivery and engineering excellence
• Outstanding career roadmap
• Leadership development, career advising, soft skills and well-being programs
• Certification (GCP, Azure, AWS)
• Unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning, Get Abstract, O'Reilly, Cloud Guru
• Language classes on English and Polish for foreigners

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst

Data Analyst
• Full Time
• Gdańsk, Polska
• With Professional Experience
• 1/19/23 1172856

Food, machinery or T-shirts: Hapag-Lloyd moves goods around the globe with over 250 container ships. We connect more than 600 ports on all continents and are one of the largest liner shipping companies. More than 13,000 employees work on board, ashore or in one of our 350 offices. Together, we transport around 12 million containers per year. Our corporate values "We care. We move. We deliver" serve as coordinates on our way. They guide our collaboration with each other as colleagues and with our customers to achieve the best possible quality. In the long run, we are committed to climate and environmental protection as well as human rights and many other social issues.

About the Knowledge Center:

The Knowledge Center, located in Gdańsk, is a hub for innovation and develop state-of-the-art business and technology solutions to help us navigate the future. And we want to do that... together with you.

Team and Project overview:

As Business Intelligence & Analytics (BIA) department, data is our passion. We support our colleagues across the globe to take data-driven decisions, spot further opportunities to turn Hapag-Lloyd into a data leader and bring new data products to our customers. Together, we collaborate, prototype, innovate, build, and share.

Being part of BIA, the Market Intelligence team focuses on competition and market developments like product set up, projected market growth or economic predictions. We see tricky details and conflicting data as motivation to provide cleaned data and new market insights to the organization as basis for tactical and strategical business decisions. BIA is located both in Hamburg and Gdansk. The Market Intelligence team is located in Hamburg; we are now looking for you as first Market Intelligence colleague in Gdansk.

As part of our team, you will:
• Make a difference: Work with colleagues across Hapag-Lloyd (e.g., Trade Management, Networks, Strategy Office) to ensure they have all necessary decision-critical data and act as a sparring partner for them to generate data-based insights. Also work extensively with external partners (e.g., data providers) to enhance the market insights within the Hapag-Lloyd world.
• Take ownership: Identify and challenge data and analytics opportunities and drive their implementation.
• Have impact: Take over responsibility in international, cross-functional projects to ensure that every strategic initiative at Hapag-Lloyd is designed with data in mind.
• Build bridges: Be in constant exchange with the business teams, our data scientists, and the IT teams to translate business requirements into user stories for implementation.
• Create transparency: Visualize complex data in an appealing, target-oriented, and creative form as well as assess the data quality and, if necessary, improve it by, for example, predictive analytics methods.
• Innovate: Design, develop, and implement new advanced analytics solutions (e.g., machine learning) in the field of market intelligence. You test data science elements, such as ML/AI and shape the way towards innovation

As your new team, we will:
• Provide a challenging and fun, impactful, and empowering place to work
• Offer you individual development opportunities including conferences, trainings, and team-internal learning sessions

Requirements and Qualifications:
• You hold a university degree (ideally focused on business administration, logistics or business informatics) and you are excited about applying your technical and analytical expertise to the world of global logistics
• You have a track record of successfully analyzing data and combining operational and commercial domains – ideally in the maritime or logistics environment.
• Experience in project and process management is a plus.
• You present results to your team and our business stakeholders in a concise and convincing way.
• Your way of working is assertive, goal-oriented and pragmatic – as a team player you appreciate a close collaboration throughout your team and in international project groups
• Next to excellent skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, you are interested in advancing your knowledge of BI tools like Qlik, Tableau or Alteryx. Alternatively, you are experienced in common analytics programming languages such as Python or R.
• Excellent command of spoken and written English completes your profile.

We offer:
• Private medical care (Luxmed)
